p:
Since the measures of phenological responses are sensitive to methodological biases
30 , in particular to temporal trends in species abundance
32 , we also refitted an extended version of model 2 by additionally including abundance both as a fixed-effect explanatory variable and as an explanatory variable for residual variance (Methods). This model was fitted to a subset of studies for which we could extract abundance data. In all models, we accounted for first-order temporal autocorrelation (if this increased the predictive power of the fitted model), and thus also considered year (modelled as a qualitative variable) as a random effect.
